Though the cavern is constantly illuminated, the light flutters as if it were a flame caught in a breeze. Oranges and reds fade to cool blues and greens before flaring back to life once again. A stone bench rests outside of a nearby home, often occupied with the city's visitors who are unaccustomed to the fiery display.

node.name: Trabe Plateau, Traveler's Yurt
node.description: Daylight shines down through a wide circular hole in the center of the roof, illuminating the interior. Unlit candles sit on brass holders mounted to the ironwood lattice-work walls of the yurt. Woven multicolored rugs marred with muddy tracks cover the entire floor.

Lit candles sit on brass holders mounted to the ironwood lattice-work walls of the yurt, casting wan illumination through the interior. The acrid smoke of the tapers escapes out of a wide circular hole in the center of the roof. Woven multicolored rugs marred with muddy tracks cover the entire floor.

node.name: Trabe Plateau, Northern Edge
node.description: A vertical drop, far too steep to climb down, marks the northern limits of the plateau. The Arid Steppe stretches for countless miles north, a flatland of uninterrupted frost and tall grasses.

A vertical drop, far too steep to climb down, marks the northern limits of the plateau. Everything beyond the drop has been plunged into a primal darkness by the night, without so much as a single dot of light across the steppe.

node.name: Trabe Plateau, Eastern Edge
node.description: Far to the east, beyond the vertical edge of the plateau, a narrow river cuts through a portion of the steppe. A few stunted trees, little more than brown dots from this vantage point, cling to the distant riverbank.
Far to the east, beyond the vertical edge of the plateau, a few pale points of light can be seen on the steppe floor. Other than those faint hints of civilization, the night's cloak is complete.

node.name: Trabe Plateau, The Spire
node.description: Veins of silvery-blue crystal run through the surface of the plateau, like the roots of a tree. No grass grows within a few feet of even the smallest shoot of the vein, leaving a vast swath of the area barren. A large spire made of the same material rises to the west.

Veins of glowing blue crystal run through the surface of the plateau, like the roots of a tree. No grass grows within a few feet of even the smallest shoot of the veins, leaving a vast swath of the area barren. A large spire made of the same material rises to the west, casting light across the entire plateau.

node.name: Trabe Plateau, The Spire
node.description: An enormous spire of silvery-blue crystal rises from the center of plateau, dozens of feet across and hundreds of feet straight into the air. Walkways connect the spire at various heights to crystalline structures to the north and south, while a broken spur juts out into the air to the west.

An enormous spire of silvery-blue crystal rises from the center of plateau, dozens of feet across and hundreds of feet straight into the air. Walkways connect the spire at various heights to crystalline structures to the north and south, while a broken spur juts out into the air to the west. The entire construct glows with an inner luminescence, casting the barren ground in blue light.

node.name: Trabe Plateau, The Spire
node.description: Broken crystal towers rise up from the grass, brittle and white as bone. The towers are massive, dozens of feet across and thrice as high. Yet despite their mass, they end in jagged shards and deep fractures, as though a giant had shattered the crystals. A large spire rises to the east, silvery-blue and undamaged.

Broken crystal towers rise up from the grass, brittle and white as bone. The towers are massive, dozens of feet across and thrice as high. Yet despite their mass, they end in jagged shards and deep fractures, as though a giant had shattered the crystals. A large spire rises to the east, glowing like Xibar in the night.

node.name: Trabe Plateau, Western Edge
node.description: Loose dirt and rocks cover the western edge of the plateau, which descends in a slope rather than a vertical wall of stone. The incline sharply drops down a few hundred feet to the steppe, where the debris turns into miles upon miles of grass.

Loose dirt and rocks cover the western edge of the plateau, which descends in a slope rather than a vertical wall of stone. The incline sharply drops down into the darkness below, where the debris turns into an expanse of unlit land.

node.name: Trabe Plateau, Southern Edge
node.description: A seemingly endless plain of grass stretches out to the south, dotted sporadically by sparse copses of stunted trees. The wall of the plateau dips and forms a steep switchback path down its southern face.

A seemingly endless plain of grass stretches out to the south, blighted and desolate under the shadows of the night. The wall of the plateau dips and forms a steep switchback path down its southern face.

node.name: Trabe Plateau, The Spire
node.description: Smooth silvery-blue crystal towers rise up from the grass. The towers are massive, dozens of feet across and at least a hundred feet high at their apices. Lifeless dirt surrounds the base of each tower, creating distinct barren circles that radiate a few feet outward. An even larger spire rises to the south, connected to these towers by walkways high above.

Smooth silvery-blue crystal towers rise up from the grass. The towers are massive, dozens of feet across and at least a hundred feet high at their apices. Lifeless dirt surrounds the base of each tower, creating distinct barren circles that radiate a few feet outward. Connected to these towers by walkways high above, an even larger spire rises to the south, glowing like the surface of Xibar.

node.name: Trabe Plateau, The Spire
node.description: Bizarre shapes of silvery-blue crystal seem to grow from the earth. A veritable forest of crystalline plants cluster together, their slender limbs twisted into spirals and entangled amongst each other a few dozen feet above. No grass grows around the crystal objects, leaving the entire area barren of life. A large spire made of the same material rises to the north.

Bizarre shapes of glowing blue crystal seem to grow from the earth. A veritable forest of crystalline plants cluster together, their slender limbs twisted into spirals and entangled amongst each other a few dozen feet above. No grass grows around the crystal objects, leaving the entire area barren of life. A large spire made of the same material rises to the north, bathing the entire area in silvery-blue light.

node.name: The Spire, First Floor
node.description: Elk-fur rugs decorate the floors, sharply contrasting with the near-total presence of the color blue. A uniform silvery-blue covers most of the floors, walls, and distant ceiling, interrupted only by jagged white scars. The scars are gouged into the crystalline substance and appear frequently near the arch to the outside. A staircase leads up a considerable distance to the next floor, following the spiral of the circular inner wall.

node.name: The Spire, Second Floor
node.description: Concentric grooves radiate evenly along the floor, leading to a shattered white crystal in the center of the room. Large furs cover the crystalline walls, but do little to stop the wind from whipping through wide slits along the cardinal directions. A spiral staircase follows the inner wall, leading both further up the spire and down toward the ground.

node.name: The Spire, Broken Walkway
node.description: Shattered towers of bone-white crystal rise around a broken walkway that is suspended a hundred feet above the plateau. The walkway stops abruptly before it reaches the center of the cluster, ending in a jagged edge of white shards. Wind from the steppe plays across the shattered crystals, creating a high-pitched moan.

Shattered towers of bone-white crystal, lit by the blue light of the eastern spire, rise around a broken walkway that is suspended in the darkness. The walkway stops abruptly before it reaches the center of the cluster, ending in a jagged edge of white shards. Wind from the steppe plays across the shattered crystals, creating a high-pitched moan.

node.name: The Spire, Balcony
node.description: A wide semi-circular platform extends outward from the middle of the crystalline spire and faces the east. Winds blow across the platform freely, unhindered due to the lack of any rail or parapet. The Arid Steppe stretches out across the horizon from this vantage point, filled with sparse trees, narrow rivers and countless acres of grass.

A wide semi-circular platform extends outward from the middle of the crystalline spire and faces the east. Winds blow across the platform freely, unhindered due to the lack of any rail or parapet. The Arid Steppe stretches out across the horizon from this vantage point, a vast flatland of shadows beneath the night sky.

node.name: The Spire, Walkway
node.description: Gusts of wind blow up from the steppe below, howling like a madman across the exposed walkway. Ten feet wide and a hundred feet up from the plateau, the structure lacks the roof and rails that might otherwise help keep the elements off and a traveler on. The walkway is straight as an arrow, connecting the top of a tower to the north with the middle of a much larger spire to the south.

Gusts of wind blow up from the steppe below, howling like a madman across the exposed walkway. Ten feet wide and suspended in the darkness, the structure lacks the roof and rails that might otherwise help keep the elements off and a traveler on. The walkway is straight as an arrow, connecting the top of a glowing blue tower to the north with the middle of a much larger spire to the south.

node.name: The Spire, Walkway
node.description: A lattice of narrow walkways expands outward from the northern spire to the top of a maze of twisted crystalline structures. Five feet wide and a hundred feet up from the plateau, the walkways lack the roof and rails that might otherwise keep the wind off and a traveler on.

A lattice of narrow walkways expands outward from the northern spire to the top of a maze of glowing crystalline structures. Five feet wide and suspended in the night, the walkways lack the roof and rails that might otherwise keep the wind off and a traveler on.

node.name: The Spire, Guildleader's Chamber
node.note: GL Moon Mage|GL MM|Cherulisa|RS Moon Mage
node.description: Great arched windows are carved from the crystalline walls, allowing an unparalleled view of the Arid Steppe whenever the wind jostles the heavy leather curtains. Heavy furs are heaped across the floor, their piles indented inward from use. The low howl of the winds outside mixes with the creaking of the curtains, filling the chamber with a constant drone.

Great arched windows are carved from the crystalline walls, allowing an unparalleled view of the night whenever the wind jostles the heavy leather curtains. Heavy furs are heaped across the floor, their piles indented inward from use. The low howl of the winds outside mixes with the creaking of the curtains, filling the chamber with a constant drone.

node.name: The Spire, Chamber of Artifice
node.description: A spacious enchanter's workshop is set up in the chamber, bringing such disparate furnishings as a writing desk and an anvil together in the same room. A vice holds the femur of a lamb over a furnace of incandescent energy, while thin iron rods hang on the southern wall, far away from the rest of the equipment.

node.name: The Spire, Chamber of Contemplation
node.description: Four sheep-skin rugs are laid across the cold floor at the cardinal points of the room, providing places to sit with minimal discomfort. Pale white streaks mar the otherwise pristine silvery-blue crystalline walls, clustered predominately on the northern wall.

node.name: Inner Hibarnhvidar, Behind the Forge
node.description: Blasts of heat rise from a radiant vent in the floor, far too hot for any mortal to survive. Several smaller crevices exhibit the same molten glow. Curiously, a tempered steel grate covers the vent, and guards stand duty just outside the door. Other, cooler cracks lead downward, though only one is wide enough to allow you to squeeze through.

node.name: Inner Hibarnhvidar, Public Library
node.description: Skillfully cut into the stone of the mountain, this chamber houses many books that the people of Hibarnhvidar find important. Several citizens mill about, browsing the books on the shelves, speaking softly to one another and discussing their opinions on various subjects. The Dwarven librarian welcomes patrons into the library, gesturing to an engraved silver sign.

node.name: The Stony Hub, Entryway
node.description: Stark walls of cold polished stone gleam with an eternal beauty all their own. Dark obsidian benches line each side of the entryway while tall iron sconces lend their light to the darkness, outlining a broad archway nearby.

node.name: The Stony Hub, Sitting Room
node.description: Dark leather armchairs flank a large, carved stone fireplace. Its wide mantle is decorated with dried flowers and a mixture of semi-precious stones. A mirror above the mantle reflects light from dozens of lit candles placed throughout the room.

node.name: The Stony Hub, East Hallway
node.description: This short hallway features curved ceilings and polished iron chandeliers. Along its pale grey walls are caricatures of various patrons of the club, some in bizarre positions while others look almost lifelike. Music is heard from one end of the hall, enticing those nearby to enter.

node.name: The Stony Hub, Cavern
node.description: This spacious cavern provides room for gatherings that the club hosts. A scattering of tables and chairs offer seating for those listening to visiting bards, while decorative screens lead to the dance floor. Dark iron chandeliers hung from the high ceiling light the whole area in a nice, soft warm glow.

node.name: The Stony Hub, West Hallway
node.description: This short hallway connects to the busiest part of the hub. Patrons come and go from the banking area, often muttering about funds and fees. Painted along the walls are muted images of various plant life.

node.name: The Stony Hub, Banking Needs
node.description: Pewter sconces light this stark granite area. Bank clerks sit behind dark oak tables with rugged Dwarven guards standing nearby. Dark red woven rugs line the floor for warmth and offer a nice contrast to the otherwise bare decor.

node.name: The Stony Hub, Exchange
node.description: A brazier placed in the corner warms this small room. Half of the area is fitted with iron bars, which keep the clients separated from the Moon Mages who move coins from different locations.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, City Offices
node.description: Small gaethzen spheres line this foyer leading to the city's offices. Atop a pedestal, a marble statue of Hexoch, the Dwarven king, supervises all the work that goes on in the offices to the south. During business hours, various denizens of the mountain city rush about to do business in the city's administrative center.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Office of Debts
node.description: The Debtor's Office for Hibarnhvidar stretches off into the mountain, its back wall obscured by pipe smoke and distance. A lone Dwarf sits behind the service counter, taking the money of the citizens of the province of Forfedhdar. Behind him, rank upon rank of desks are placed in neat orderly rows, where, during the day, clerks sit updating the accounts of all the citizens in the land.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Office of Citizenship
node.description: A squat counter stretches from wall to wall, behind which a lone Dwarven clerk sits smoking a pipe. The smoke from his pipe winds its way up through a tiny slit in the ceiling. Occasionally, another Dwarf will run in and hand something to the clerk, but the exchange is too fast to see what is being passed.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Office of Housing
node.description: Desks line the walls of this room, though only one is occupied. The others are piled high with what look to be architectural drawings and other documents. The one clerk on duty continues looking over a pile of papers on his desk, glancing up only briefly when someone enters the office.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Office of Moving
node.description: Tucked away into a small alcove, a lone clerk fusses about the cramped office. Parchments and maps line the walls and ceiling, many covered with poorly drawn neighborhoods from throughout the realms. Traffic here is slow, but the clerk is quick to notice and greet those who enter.

node.name: Justice Office, Front Desk
node.description: The glow cast by oil lamps set into the rough granite walls fails to bring any warmth to this grim cavern. A bored looking Dwarven constable sits behind a slate desk covered with neat stacks of papers. The walls narrow toward the rear of the chamber, but a glint of light indicates that there is something more beyond.

node.name: Justice Office, Chief Constable's Office
node.description: A large, blocky desk spans nearly the entire breadth of this room. Behind it sits a white-bearded Dwarf, peering over the top of a pair of square-rimmed spectacles. The walls are lined with several framed portraits of Dwarves in constable uniforms.

node.name: Justice Office, Judge's Chambers
node.description: A squat grey marble dais sits in the center of one end of this room. Cold stone walls add to the foreboding aura of the chamber. From here judgment is passed upon those who run afoul of the law in Hibarnhvidar.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Bank Foyer
node.description: The ornate entrance arch gives way to a long hall, filled with accountants and bookkeepers. Opposing the arch, two tunnels lead deeper into the bank to the foreign exchange and teller windows. Several Dwarven employees wander about, conversing with colleagues seated at the desks.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Teller Windows
node.description: Two Dwarven guards stand at the entrance to the tunnel leading back to the bank foyer, insuring the safety and security of deposited funds. Several alcoves are available in the cavern walls to allow for privacy as one converses with the tellers on the other side of the stone counters.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Foreign Exchange Office
node.description: A small opening sits embedded in the wall opposite the tunnel to the bank foyer. This part of the cavern claims only a narrow garbage trough and the exchange window as adornment. A short Dwarven banker sits behind the metal grille, waiting to exchange patron's money into other currencies.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Hospital, Entrance Room
node.description: This room, located just off the main cavern, serves as a junction for the different locations within the hospital. In addition to serving as the workplace for the resident healer Shalvarn, whose office is located through a small door to the west, the infirmary allows other healers to stop by and help with the demand for healing.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Hospital, Volunteer Room
node.description: Small alcoves set into each of the four walls hold short canvas cots to raise the patients off the cold stone. The center of the room is mostly empty save for several large pillows piled there. A white cabinet rests against the north wall between two of the bays.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Hospital, Sitting Room
node.description: Located just off the entrance hall, this room allows members of the community a quiet space to sit and relax while waiting to be seen by Shalvarn. Several chairs lie scattered about the room in small groups, enabling friends to have a quiet chat.

node.name: Dadzi's Skrawt Stal, Glan Gulth
node.description: Its polished ebonwood and heavy crystal doors set the tone of opulence and Dwarven artisanship continued within this shop. Pale pink granite floors peek from beneath luxuriously bleached and combed wooly sheepskin. Cool alabaster showcases, themselves artistically shaped, display their contents on velvet beds. A silk divan in the center of the room provides seating for weary shoppers, or those suffering from sticker shock.

node.name: Dadzi's Skrawt Stal, Kwar Stof
node.description: Soft lights, recessed in the stone ceiling, bathe this space with a faint blue glow and create the impression of the night sky. A small settee covered in silver bear pelts sits on a midnight blue carpet sheared in a latticework pattern. Four displays, topped with silver velvet, resemble the moons of Elanthia and encircle the settee.

node.name: Dadzi's Skrawt Stal, Hivdar Stof
node.description: This white granite room has an intricately carved dome supported by a series of arcades. Refreshing breezes move unimpeded through the open design, creating a sense of spacious grandeur. Beneath a strong gaethzen orb is a glass showcase, where Dadzi's most scintillating designs tend to elicit desire in the eyes of Hibarnhvidar's residents.

node.name: Dadzi's Skrawt Stal, Rawdh Stof
node.description: Muffling sounds down to the level of a whisper, dark red carpeting covers the floor and provides a subtle showcase for silver toned displays. A brocade sofa at the far end of the room is flanked by a dainty white table with cups and a teapot for those contemplating a purchase.

node.name: Dadzi's Skrawt Stal, Gwel Stof
node.description: Bits of various colored jade interspersed with cool, white tile create an almost antiseptic atmosphere which continues with only one display, centered in the room. A low, narrow green bench rests against the wall leading to the red room.

node.name: Cargil's Engraving, Showroom
node.description: Shields displaying examples of the fine work done by the proprietor line the walls of this neat, compact shop. On a low marble counter sits a gold-embossed menu board, which enumerates the options offered. Cargil, the engraver, sits atop a squat stool in front of a heavy curtain leading to his workroom.

node.name: Stawk's Brothers Mineral and Supply
node.description: The entire room has been roughly chipped out of the surrounding stone. Crates and boxes are haphazardly strewn about with merchandise, while a single chunk of stone with a slightly flattened surface sits in the middle of the room, chained to the floor. An old corner table stands in the back of the cavern, covered with a thick layer of dust and carrying a lone item which apparently receives little attention from the local customers. Across from the exit into the upper cavern is a bolted iron door.

node.name: Cavern of Fire, Stalagmite Maze
node.description: The air feels thick and heavy with humidity as the heat bakes away what moisture seeps from the cavern's rocky walls. Stalagmites jut up from the floor, forcing travelers to make their way through a confusing maze of passages that twist and turn, some rising, some falling, some doubling back upon themselves. The haze of smoke, lit by a faint glow emanating from hairline cracks in the walls, makes the cavern even more disorienting.

node.name: Gate to Hibarnhvidar
node.description: Nestled against a steep incline, a massive stone gate stands between the road proper and the city of Hibarnhvidar. Slight movement can be seen high atop the platforms that flank the gate's entrance. Carefully laid stonework provides a broad area just before the gate, and narrows into the path leading away from the city. Brushed and smoothed, the stones are evenly spaced, all traces of weed or loose gravel removed. A multi-pointed star marks the stone at the center of the entryway.

node.name: Vandorf's House of Hides
node.description: The smell of curing hides clings to the air, cloying the nostrils with a heavy unpleasant smell of decayed animal flesh. A thick cord draped with various furs extends from one end of the room to the other, acting as a makeshift curtain that leads to the back room. The shop owner Vandorf tends to his furs, stopping every so often to acknowledge customers that walk in to do business.

node.name: Drangvold's Sundries, Sales Floor
node.description: Stacked stone chinked with straw and plaster form the base for an unusual lichen painting on the back wall of the shop. Subtle shades of blues and greens mingle with grey and brown in a seascape, far from the sight or smell of the ocean. The other walls are hidden by rows of shelves creaking beneath the weight of the goods offered for sale in the town's general store.

node.name: The Singing Raven, Common Room
node.description: A perpetual haze of tobacco smoke hangs just under the low ceiling, illuminated from beneath by the orange glow of the roaring fire in the flagstone fireplace that takes up most of one wall. Opposite it, a long bar runs the length of the room. Rough wooden tables and chairs are scattered about, of wildly varying sizes to accommodate travelers of all races. Day and night, the room is filled by those stopping for a bite to eat or liquid refreshment.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Inn, Private Parlor
node.description: The sounds of activity from the common room are muted here, although the pungent smell of tobacco smoke drifts in on a slight draft. Small and windowless, the room is lit by a stone fireplace on the far wall, and a hurricane lamp placed in the middle of the centered round table.

node.name: The Singing Raven, Upstairs Hall
node.description: A single glass-enclosed lantern on one wall provides the only light on the narrow landing. The flickering flame inside wavers and gutters, casting moving shadows along the wood-paneled walls.

node.name: The Singing Raven, Pine Room
node.description: A faint scent of baking bread drifts through the small room, apparently located somewhere near the kitchens. The knotty pine paneling's warm yellow hue is matched by the bed coverings on the low, thick mattress.

node.name: The Singing Raven, Peregan Room
node.description: Warm golden highlights glint from the deep brown wood-paneled walls. An immense four-poster bed dominates the room, covered in thick, clean-smelling down comforters and piles of fluffy pillows. A small table is placed conveniently close to the bed, holding simple refreshments.

node.name: Second Provincial Bank of Hibarnhvidar
node.description: The tiny fires of hundreds of candles placed in all corners of the room cast gleaming warm highlights that reflect off the polished wood from which the bank lobby was built. Thick beams criss-cross the ceiling, and solid pillars -- looking as though they were made of whole tree trunks -- march along all four walls. The wood is a medium shade, neither oppressively dark nor so light as to appear freshly cut, and has been lovingly polished until it glows.

node.name: Second Provincial Bank of Hibarnhvidar, Exchange
node.description: The exchange clerks sit behind a low counter, separated from the entry area by a thick pane of glass with a small hole cut in it at mouth-level, and a scooped-out area cut into the wooden counter underneath it so coins can be pushed through to the other side. The bored-looking clerks scurry to and fro within their glass cage, moving papers from one desk to another with a great show of efficiency.

node.name: Second Provincial Bank of Hibarnhvidar, Teller
node.description: Bored-looking Gor'Tog clerks sit behind a high counter topped by a bronze railing, wakening as people come and go. Large, solid wooden desks fill their area, and sturdy file cabinets line the walls. On the customer side of the counter, the floor is covered with plush carpeting and the walls are covered in rich brocade cloth and wainscotted below.

node.name: Drones and Drums
node.description: Several shelves and racks line the flagstone walls of the shop, each displaying a variety of instruments and accessories. Anniana, the Gor'Tog proprietor, stands behind a prominent counter near the wall opposite the entry, dusting and cleaning her wares when not assisting customers. Resting at one end of the counter is a packed scroll case, while a display stand flanks the other. In the center of the room, a long oak table displays an assortment of bagpipes.

node.name: Reliable Pawn and Dry Goods Emporium
node.description: Tiny and dark, the shop is lit only by a smoke-darkened lantern hanging directly over the tall counter dividing the room. In front of the counter is only a bucket and an expanse of wood-planked floor, dirt-blackened in the corners but with a polished trail leading straight in from the doorway. Behind the counter are heaps and piles of used goods, some sorted and others simply stacked.

node.name: New Lamps for Gold
node.description: Hibarnhvidar's lamp and lantern shop is either cozy or cramped, depending on one's outlook. Three or four customers would crowd this tiny establishment, but almost all of the wares are within arm's length, except for the flammable stuff. That sits behind a high counter out of reach of the public.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Traders' Guild Auction Tent
node.description: The tent is made of durable off-white canvas, secured by heavy ropes and nine large metal poles. Lanterns hang from small hooks on each pole, making the room bright enough to examine all the goods being sold. An auction table sits on a platform fashioned out of crates, while boxes and barrels of merchandise hug the walls. Screwed into the central pole is a metal plaque upon which rests the auction list.

The tent is made of durable off-white canvas and secured by heavy ropes and eight large metal poles. Natural light filters through the material, while lanterns hang from small hooks on each pole in case more is needed. An auction table sits on a platform fashioned out of crates, while boxes and barrels of merchandise hug the walls. Screwed into the central pole is a metal plaque upon which rests the auction list.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Trader Guild, The Floor
node.description: This long, wide room appears to be a partially converted brewery, the air still filled with the scent of ale. Rows of casks line the walls, leaving the center of the floor clear to make room for business. Clerks, traders and commodity brokers intermingle with local farmers and miners to discuss the ever-changing prices of commodities, while the noisy sound of braying animals can be heard to the east.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Trader Guild, Stables
node.description: Mountain hardy beasts of all sorts find themselves in neighboring stalls in this slightly cramped but serviceable stable. Bales of alfalfa and hay have been pushed against the wall, leaving only the bare minimum amount of area needed to lead caravans and carts in and out from the road.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Trader Guild, Office of Interprovincial Trade
node.description: A foil map hangs across the back wall, tinted and textured to show the five provinces of Elanthia. Other than that single piece of elegance, the room is completely utilitarian with a wooden plank floor and a single desk of neatly stacked paperwork.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Trader Guild, Rock Garden
node.description: This long abandoned portion of the brewery has been cleaned up and turned into an exquisite rock garden. An intentionally meandering path of carefully pieced slate rock connects the stables and cask room, as well as a shiny brass contraption in the western garden. Old ale casks, cut in half, have been used as picturesque flower boxes, while other pieces of cask have been used as trimming around individual beds nestled within colorful collections of polished stone.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Trader Guild, Rock Garden
node.description: The dazzling rock garden occupying the wide warehouse portion of this old brewery has been muted by the presence of a lone working still that takes up the western portion of the wall. Several Dwarven workers tend to the still, oblivious to the beauty of the arrangements of colored rock and crystal around them. Channels of water run through the garden both to further beautify the area as well as to keep the room at a comfortable temperature.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Trader Guild, Cask Room
node.description: Damp and cool, this room acts as a tasting room for guests and a break room for clerks, although it is hard to say who is actually doing the most sampling.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Trader Guild, Guild Leader's Office
node.description: The Guildmaster's office has been carefully coordinated to incorporate the vision of a sun rising above the mountains. Purple and gold silk drapes hang loosely against the stone walls with light from wall sconces peeking through behind it like the first rays of a new morning in a cloudy sky. A large gold-inlaid rosewood desk glows in the reflected light from the smokeless candles set about the room. On a small shelf behind the desk rests a crystal decanter and four matching wine glasses.

node.name: Albreda's Shrine, Entry Hall
node.description: Carved inside a huge mica streak with the entrance in a corner, the shrine walls confer the impression of being inside a diamond. Stone balustrades create a diagonal pathway leading further into the shrine while life-size doves carved from pure white quartz hover over alcoves on either side. Slight variations in height and color give the blue tile floor a resemblance to waves in an ocean.
Carved inside a huge mica streak with the entrance in a corner, stone balustrades create a diagonal pathway leading further into the shrine.

node.name: Albreda's Shrine, Peace Alcove
node.description: A stone bench faces the semi-circular wall of the alcove providing seating for those who would contemplate the bas-relief artwork. The carved collage depicts moments in Elanthian history that range from a quiet gathering to a signing ceremony between fierce warriors. Inset into the ocean-blue mosaic floor is a beautiful white dove.
A stone bench faces the semi-circular wall of the alcove providing seating for those who would contemplate the bas-relief artwork depicting Elanthian history.

node.name: Albreda's Shrine, Family Alcove
node.description: Situated within individual niches in the cavern wall are miniature figures of families doing things together. Tableaus depict families at work, at play, at a wedding, doing daily chores, celebrating a birth and mourning the loss of a loved one. Stone stools in several heights are arranged before the niches.
Situated within individual niches in the cavern wall are miniature figures of families doing things together. Stone stools in several heights are arranged before the wall.

node.name: Albreda's Shrine, Offering Room
node.description: The roughly chiseled walls and dirt floor contrast sharply with the artistic bent in the other areas of the shrine. A lone covered table stands in the center of the floor with a paltry selection of offerings for sale. Some cooing sounds escape from beneath the tablecloth.
A lone table, covered with paltry offerings for sale, stands in the center of the room's dirt floor.

node.name: Albreda's Shrine, Hall of Reflections
node.description: The long, narrow mirrors that line the walls of this area are hung so as to infinitely reproduce each other and the altar. This design results in constant reflection, which deliberately encourages occupants to look deep within to find reality.
The long, narrow mirrors that line the walls have been designed to infinitely reproduce each other and the altar, encouraging occupants to look deep within themselves.

node.name: Albreda's Shrine, Healer's Haven
node.description: Blue and green tiles set in an alternating diamond pattern give an expansive feeling to the floor. Divans sit along the walls beneath frescos of herbs and gardens that soar to the vaulted ceiling where a huge wagon wheel full of lit candles brightens the area.
Divans sit along the walls beneath frescos of herbs and gardens that soar to the vaulted ceiling.

node.name: Agrobov's Green Grocer
node.description: The foyer of this three-story building also doubles as a produce shop and has been lined with wood-chips and straw to facilitate cleaning. Agrobov slumps on a stool in the corner, next to a bushel of corn husks. A bucket containing bags marked with their supposed weight rests beneath a set of scales suspended from the ceiling.

node.name: Micmi's Fruit Shop
node.description: Tiers of carefully crafted baskets hold fruit not yet ripe enough to satisfy Micmi's penchant for selling perfect fruit. A spare set of blocks rests against one wall, waiting to steady her stand if need be.

node.name: Outer Hibarnhvidar, Fortuneteller's Tent
node.description: Beneath a colorful sign draped along the length of the tent's roof is a small round table covered in a loud paisley-patterned cloth. A thick scent of incense permeates the air, and the room is dimly illuminated by a single lantern shielded with red glass. Seated in the back is an elderly Gor'Tog woman wearing dangly earrings and a folded kerchief on her head.

node.name: The Three Turnips, Common Room
node.description: A semicircle of lumpy overstuffed chairs faces a roaring fire crackling in a large flagstone hearth set into the rear wall of this spacious chamber. The remainder of the space is covered by heavily scarred oaken tables, most of them replete with massive frothing tankards and wide platters heaped with the hearty fare favored by Toggish laborers. Based on the relaxed postures of many of the patrons, it is clear that they consider this their home away from home.

node.name: The Three Turnips, Banquet Hall
node.description: Unlike the atmosphere in the rest of this establishment, there is an air of formality here. The enormous long table that runs nearly the entire length of the room is draped in white linen, and there are centerpieces of freshly cut flowers at regular intervals. The chairs are in markedly better repair than those found in the common room.

node.name: The Three Turnips, Taproom
node.description: Several thick-legged stools, braced for the weight of the pub's massive patrons, line the front of a long wooden, slightly warped bar. On the barkeep's side are stands supporting three large kegs and a shelf filled with a motley array of bottles and jars. A large rectangular mirror covers most of the back wall, affording drinkers the opportunity to make faces at themselves while they enjoy their libations.

node.name: The Three Turnips, Game Room
node.description: This room has been set aside for 'Togs who wish to divert themselves with something other than mere eating and drinking. Mounted on the back wall is a well-used two-colored dartboard. Numerous nicks and gouges beyond the border of the target silently testify to the fact that the contestants are often more enthusiastic than skillful. A few scattered armchairs are provided for the comfort of those waiting their turns to cause structural damage.

node.name: Yamka Wan Bakery
node.description: Motes of white drift through the air, dusting patrons with flour or coating them in sugar depending on what is baking at the moment. A wood counter, built of peeled logs thick enough to support the weight of customers peering over at the merchandise, displays pans with the shop's offerings for the day.

node.name: Yamka Wan Bakery, Lapnaka Udak
node.description: Heat radiates from a huge oven that dominates one wall of this expansive kitchen. Pots, pans, and a variety of cooking utensils hang from hooks above the broad counters. Off to one side is a long bench next to a picnic table piled high with piping hot pies.

node.name: Smavold's Toggery
node.description: The heavy treads of many Gor'Tog customers have worn down the well-swept flagstone floor. The same stone creates the walls, leading to a thatched roof. Flanking the doors on either side are two large windows which gaze upon the Green. Several shelves adorn the walls, leading to what seems to be the sales counter. The shopkeeper, Smavold, wields a broom as he patrols the store, cleaning the floor and keeping a watchful eye on his merchandise.

The heavy treads of many Gor'Tog customers have worn down the well-swept flagstone floor. The same stone creates the walls, leading to a thatched roof. Torches line the walls, illuminating the shop. Several shelves adorn the walls, leading to what seems to be the sales counter. The shopkeeper, Smavold, rests upon a stool, keeping an eye on his goods.

The heavy treads of many Gor'Tog customers have worn down the well-swept flagstone floor. The same stone creates the walls, leading to a thatched roof. Torches line the walls, illuminating the shop. Several shelves adorn the walls, leading to what seems to be the sales counter. The shopkeeper, Smavold, rests upon a stool, keeping an eye on his goods.

node.name: Gor'Tog District, Behind a Stone Hut
node.description: Leaning against the back wall of the hut, a massively muscular Gor'Tog hums to himself. He is having some difficulty staying on key, but it doesn't seem to bother him much. Several massive sledgehammers lie amid fragments of rock scattered widely about the area, almost as if there had been an explosion.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Orphanage Common Room
node.description: The confines of a low ramshackle building converted to living quarters are furnished haphazardly. Doors, arch, hallway and alcove branch off from the long squat common room without symmetry, giving the appearance of being tacked on as needed. A wood stove burns brightly, mismatched benches and chairs pulled in a cluster around it. Only windows on the street side of the building contribute light or fresh air, and although the room looks frayed and made of collected discards, it is clean and neat.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Orphanage Classroom
node.description: A shelf holds writing slates and chalk for lessons, and long backless benches stand arranged in symmetrical rows. At the far side of the room is a table displaying student efforts. Of note is a large, chipped ceramic bowl furnished with water, pebbles and turtle.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Orphanage Library
node.description: Tucked in the front corner of the common room, the library bookshelves form two of the walls to divide it as a separate room. The largest window in the whole orphanage looks out into the street, so during daylight hours it is the brightest lit and cheeriest of nooks. A comfortable chair is a favorite spot, and its faded cover and squashed cushion suggest many children have retreated here.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Orphanage Dining Room
node.description: Three long tables and their associated benches nearly fill the room it requires a good deal of careful stepping and squeezing to move past them. Old bottles holding bouquets of flowering weeds serve as centerpieces. Light from an old oil lantern dangling from a ceiling chain can barely chase the dark from the windowless space -- shadows dance crookedly as it sways each time the swinging door opens and closes.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Orphanage Headmaster's Chamber
node.description: The Headmaster's chamber is no more elaborate than any other area of the orphanage. His battered desk is missing a drawer, and his chair's rungs are reinforced with twine. A window - a luxury - looks out into the street, and behind a screen is a small cot. Drawings pinned to the wall only add to the clutter. Nevertheless, there is a hint of good will in his disorder, that there is too much work for one man, but what is left undone has been put aside for the priority of affection rather than neglect.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Orphanage Kitchen
node.description: A monstrous wood stove, a tall heavy table, and a large wash basin dominate this room dedicated to providing nourishment for the children. Soup simmers in a big iron pot, and although no one will go hungry, the meals are clearly basic. To look upon the surroundings, one would suspect that nothing like a birthday cake or sweet treats that children love comes forth from this kitchen.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Orphanage Backyard
node.description: Out the back door there is room in a strip of yard for a small herb garden and a few vegetables scratched into the hard ground. A water pump near the door is the source of water for the kitchen, baths, and drinking. At one end of the property, which runs the length of the back of the building, are a few toys that someone has forgotten to put away.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Tunal
node.description: A huge granite boulder from Outer Hibarnhvidar leads into this sharply sloping tunnel. Bricks of red-streaked granite populate the grey stone of the walls, floor, and ceiling more and more until nothing but the granite bricks frame a black iron door at the lower end.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Gatikalar Stof
node.description: Enormous granite blocks, fitted with no visible mortar, create thirty-foot walls and a vaulted ceiling. Thick veins of ore meet in a whorl in the center of the floor. In the east wall, a wrought iron keystone twenty-five feet above the floor supports a red granite arch which is flanked by two fifteen-foot-high granite arches, one black and the other grey. Flames that light the chamber rise from a trough along the top of each wall.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Vigan Stof
node.description: Curving granite blocks form the circular walls for this huge chamber. Thick veins of brick-red hematite emanate from the wrought iron keystone that supports the arch in the west wall. Long low benches have been hewn from the granite floor and surround a huge map constructed from fine metals and gemstones that is inlaid into the floor. A broad set of low stairs leads to a dais to the east.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Tawkisik Stof
node.description: The veins of hematite change to solid iron in the granite blocks nearest the dais. A raised square of granite holds the Guildleader's seat, and a nearby pedestal holds the Guildleader's tankard. A table at the rear of the dais holds an oaken hogshead. Stairs lead down from the dais.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Stable
node.description: Solidly built of thick, expertly hewn and mortared rock, the stable provides snug housing and protection from the worst of the storms that sometimes sweep over the city. A thick layer of fresh hay blankets the stone-flagged floor, cushioning the horses' hooves as they pass in and out. In one corner is a large pen holding the horses and ponies currently offered for sale.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Stable
node.description: Soft rustling sounds come from behind the wooden stalls lining each side of the stable, with an occasional whicker and the thump of hooves on straw-padded stone. Glass-enclosed lanterns hang at intervals from the exposed beams and rafters overhead, providing soft light for workers while not disturbing the sleep of the animals.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Stable
node.description: With a truly luxurious auburn beard, impressive even by Dwarven standards, Stableman Hvik presides over his small shop, offering all the supplies a horse owner requires to keep a steed in top condition. Occasionally muttering to himself in a basso profundo growl, Hvik busies himself day and night with keeping the items for sale in superb condition.

node.name: Outer Hibarnhvidar, Market Square
node.description: Cut into the southeast portion of a low stone wall, a wide ironwork archway acts as the entrance into the Market Square. Stones of varying shades of grey and dark red lay like a giant puzzle on the ground, flawlessly placed with no visible grouting in between. A pair of long plates of treated metal lies across a channel of water that interrupts the eastern side of the square. In the center of the market is a leather tent with colorful pennants on the northern side.

node.name: Outer Hibarnhvidar, Market Square
node.description: The echo of burbling water can be heard from here along with the occasional clanging sound of footsteps as shoppers cross over the metal plates that keep unwary passersby from stepping into the water channel that cuts through the northeast corner. Iron poles have been carefully set into the stonework, a sign that the central tent of the square is a permanent structure. A low wall provides the idea place to sit and rest. Hearty warm smells drift through, perhaps from a small kiosk visible to the north.

node.name: Outer Hibarnhvidar, Market Square
node.description: Carefully pruned trees on the other side of the low stone wall to provide limited shade and shelter from the elements for those who might like to rest there. Locals, travelers and merchants alike wander in and out of the Traders' tent entrance, attracted by its colorful pennants and the anticipation of a good bargain.

node.name: Outer Hibarnhvidar, Market Square
node.description: Nestled in the corner beside the low stone wall is a wooden kiosk covered with painted wooden figures of Dwarves in traditional costumes and fanciful depictions of cave flowers. A long iron pole hovers out over the water channel with several ropes tied along its length. To the west is a brightly colored entrance that leads into the tent in the center of the market square.

node.name: Outer Hibarnhvidar, Traders' Tent
node.description: The treasures of ages past pass through this tent from every part of the five provinces, making for a colorful display of goods to cater to both the wealthy and the wealthy at heart. Locals bustle in and out to peer at the curiosities brought in from the outside world and exchange coin for trinkets from the local Traders.

The treasures of ages past pass through this tent from every part of the five provinces, making for a colorful display of goods to cater to both the wealthy and the wealthy at heart. Locals bustle in and out to peer at the curiosities brought in from the outside world and exchange coin for trinkets from the local Traders. Beautifully carved lanterns dangle in a line from the ceiling and brighten up the interior.

node.name: Outer Hibarnhvidar, Traders' Tent
node.description: The treasures of ages past pass through this tent from every part of the five provinces, making for a colorful display of goods to cater to both the wealthy and the wealthy at heart. Locals bustle in and out to peer at the curiosities brought in from the outside world and exchange coin for trinkets from the local Traders.

The treasures of ages past pass through this tent from every part of the five provinces, making for a colorful display of goods to cater to both the wealthy and the wealthy at heart. Locals bustle in and out to peer at the curiosities brought in from the outside world and exchange coin for trinkets from the local Traders. Beautifully carved lanterns dangle in a line from the ceiling and brighten up the interior.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, Entryway
node.description: Leading from the bustle of Inner Hibarnhvidar toward a solid oaken door, the walls of this tunnel are flanked by carvings celebrating the joys of ale. Down one side are etchings revealing numerous kegs and tavern patrons enjoying their contents. Along the other wall is a deeply engraved mural depicting the brewing process.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, Barroom
node.description: A heavy oaken door separates the cold comfort of the barroom from the echoes of the cavern outside. To either side of the bar stand several large, hunched figures, who glance furtively over their mugs and tankards as the occasional side-stepping barmaid or staggering lush wanders a bit too close for comfort. Behind the counter stands Haldram, a grey-bearded Dwarf with a fierce gaze.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, Dining Room
node.description: Despite the hustle and bustle, the dining room is well decorated. Ornate lamps hang from the rafters, colorful light streaming through stained glass panels set into wrought iron frames. Three secluded booths are accessible from here, one standing behind a suit of heavy plate armor on a wrought iron stand. The second is blocked from view by a delicate tapestry depicting a cottage set in the mountains, and the third is separated by a folding privacy screen detailed in marquetry.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, Downstairs Hallway
node.description: Settled at the bottom of a long winding staircase, the short hallway has been spared both the smoke and noise of the gaiety upstairs. Two solid doors, one banded in brass and the other in iron, lead toward private rooms while the passage continues to the southwest.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, Downstairs Hallway
node.description: Two doors, one banded in copper and the other in bronze, mark the end of the short hallway. Still well crafted from the rock of the mountain, this area seems less decorated than the upstairs, as though the available rooms it leads to were added as a necessity, rather than extra income for establishment.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, Private Room
node.description: Directly across from the door are several recessions cut into the stone walls. Each contains candles of a wide variety, casting their light against the bare rock that is most of the room. The sole comfort here is an overstuffed mattress, which itself is also nested in a bowl of hollowed stone. Bolts of tatted lace form a canopy over the bed through which shadows cast by the candlelight dance endlessly.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, Private Room
node.description: Wrought iron lends itself to frame a large four-posted bed in the center of this room. To one side is a nightstand on which rests an oil lamp, casting a steady glow which reflects the bright colors of the mosaic tiled floor.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, Private Room
node.description: A long window of darkly tinted amber glass reaches from one side of the room to the other. While too dark to see through, the window lets in just enough light from the tunnels beyond to illuminate the chamber in an orange glow. A thick rug covers the stone floor giving the room a soft touch. A bed, framed in maple and covered in plush blankets, stands against the far wall.

node.name: Hvairn's Showldh Stal
node.description: A polished bell hung from a spring on the door tinkles merrily each time someone enters the room. Redolent of pungent oak and acrid metal polish, the rough timber floorboards and walls are bare of superfluous ornament save for the wares on sale. Shields of every hue and color, shape and design fill the glass case and the wide shelf, their sumptuous elegance counterfeiting glamour where in fact there is none.

node.name: Hvairn's Heraldry Room
node.description: Pervading every nook and cranny is the prevalent stink of paint thinners and the acrid smell of burnt metal. A counter divides the room neatly into two, behind which stands a desk whose surface is edged in miniature compartments, each holding items of the trade -- ink pots, brushes, and stylus. Lyewend, who oversees the ordered chaos, stands framed by myriad small square drawers, each wooden front dotted with a small copper knob.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Carousel Central
node.description: In the center of this small cavern, a circular staircase leads further into the mountain below. A small plaque bearing the words "Rundmolen Carousel" hangs above the staircase and points into the darkness. Shouts, whistles and clicks constantly emerge from the hole in the ground -- occasionally, the entire cavern rumbles as a vault is maneuvered into place.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, The Carousel
node.description: Being so far underground, the only light this cavern receives comes from thirty gaethzen spheres set into the ceiling of the room. The spiral staircase from the main cavern enters through a hole in the ceiling and deposits its travelers in the center of the room. Frequent rumblings betray the presence of the Carousel machinery behind the solid stone walls.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Carousel Desk
node.description: The distinct rumbling of Rundmolen machinery pulses behind the walls in this tiny alcove. A tall Dwarven clerk sits behind the small stone pillar that serves as his desk and the repository of all money collected by the company.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Carousel Booth
node.description: A polished steel lever protrudes from the eastern wall of the small, granite-surfaced room, flanking a steel door to the north.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Carousel Chamber
node.description: A sturdy vault, set in the back wall, stands ready for your use. A soft thick carpet of deep red covers the floor, and the walls are streaked with traces of alexandrite. Looking at the back wall, you notice a tiny gap between it and the rest of the room.

A sturdy vault, set in the back wall, stands ready for your use. A soft thick carpet of deep red covers the floor, and the walls are streaked with traces of alexandrite. Looking at the back wall, you notice a tiny gap between it and the rest of the room. Against the wall to the left of the door sits an elegant urn on an almhara pedestal.

A sturdy vault, set in the back wall, stands ready for your use. A soft thick carpet of deep red covers the floor, and the walls are streaked with traces of alexandrite. Looking at the back wall, you notice a tiny gap between it and the rest of the room. Resting on a tsavorite stand is a tiny porcelain figure.

A sturdy vault, set in the back wall, stands ready for your use. A soft thick carpet of deep red covers the floor, and the walls are streaked with traces of alexandrite. Looking at the back wall, you notice a tiny gap between it and the rest of the room. On the wall to the left of the door hangs an oil painting.

node.name: The Fashion Firmament
node.description: The room is as dark as night, and in fact seems designed to give that illusion: through some art or science, scores of little lights twinkle on the ceiling like stars in the sky. In the darkness, the only furnishing clearly visible is a counter with a large menu beside it.

node.name: Gemsmith, Rasiya's Appraisal
node.description: Sized like an after thought, this room has just enough space for the gemsmith to conduct her business. Whether to give this area the illusion of space, or to provide something for Rasiya to rest her eyes on, the stone walls have been sculpted with flowers representative of the province.

node.name: Orfna's Oddlies
node.description: The shop is large, sectioned into separate climates and decors to accommodate a variety of animals. A small portion of the area is shrouded in shadow for the benefit of the more nocturnal beasts, while the rest is clean and brightly lit.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Entry
node.description: Illuminated warmly by flaring torches, the entrance hall has been elaborately and intricately carved into the rock. To the north, a broad ramp leads down deeper into the mountain, lined on either side by rows of columns that create patterns of shadows crisscrossing the sloping floor.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Entry Passage
node.description: Raccoons carved in bas-relief march across the base of the walls while stone ravens take wing near the ceiling. Elaborately carved columns spaced down the corridor provide shallow alcoves and shadows to rest or hide in. Images of shy welkin peek at passersby from niches in the wall and from behind columns.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Entry Passage
node.description: The bright yellow-orange light cast by the burning torches to either side creates flickering shadows, and the same errant breeze carries with it a faint, lovely scent of some costly incense. In the moving light, the wall carvings take on life and color.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Central Chamber
node.description: An enormous vaulted cavern opens out deep into the heart of the mountain, the ceiling lost in shadows far overhead. The walls of the chamber appear untouched by any tools, displaying the natural beauty of the rock cradling this underground cathedral. In its center, a highly polished granite altar rises, unadorned by carvings or ornamentation, and flanked to either side by two steadily burning tapers.
An enormous vaulted cavern opens out deep into the heart of the mountain. In its center, a highly polished granite altar rises, unadorned by carvings or ornamentation.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Passage
node.description: Two simple torches, one on each wall, illuminate this short passage with flickering, shifting light. Unlike the flames almost anywhere else in the city, they smoke and gutter as though made defectively or in too much haste. The cavern to the west is dark, the light not reaching into it.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Zachriedek's Altar
node.description: The cavern is small and the ceiling is rounded, barely high enough for a tall Human to stand without crouching, as though the workmen who created it wanted to spend no more time here than necessary. A matte black stone altar in the center of the room is split in two by a jagged crack running its full width.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Passage
node.description: The faint sound of chanting comes from somewhere not far off, reverberating softly in the narrow tunnel just enough to make determining its direction impossible. The walls are almost within touching distance to either side.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Divyaush's Altar
node.description: Though small, every inch of the snug cavern has been lovingly carved and worked by the finest masters of Dwarven stonecutting. Ribbons of precious metals intertwine with great chunks of precious and semi-precious stones, to flow and weave in patterns so complex it is difficult to believe it is all cut from the surrounding rock. In one corner, an iron railing marks a narrow stairway spiraling downward.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Passage
node.description: The passage has been carved through solid stone, straight and square-cut. Twin sets of torches burn steadily to either side, their warmth held by the rock walls.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Kertigen's Altar
node.description: A brilliant shaft of multicolored light slants down from the ceiling where a vein of prismatic quartz crystal reaches through the crust of the mountain. Day or night, whether sun or moon, natural or Dwarf-made, the beautiful rainbow of light illuminates the cavern, shining directly onto a gleaming white quartz altar.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Hall of the Dead
node.description: Stretching off into the distance as far as the light reaches, the long, low cavern holds the remains of the residents of Hibarnhvidar who have passed on to remain with their gods. Stately rows of stone catafalques bear the bones of heroes and kings, while precisely carved niches line the walls for those of poorer purse or less fame.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Pool
node.description: Irregularly shaped and with only a packed earth floor, the small cavern is warm and well-lit. A small stream falls in a musical descant from the ceiling far above to fill a small clear pool in the center of the room. There appears to be no outlet for the water though the pool remains always the same size and depth.

node.name: Serenity Pool
node.description: Surprisingly warm, the waters of the pool lap gently at its edges. While the water would be chest deep on a Dwarf, rocks protruding from the sides provide comfortable seating for almost any size bather.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Gathering Room
node.description: Set at intervals along the walls, crystal-chimneyed oil lamps provide bright illumination for reading and studying. Comfortable chairs and couches are placed around the room in groups, with a few small study tables in the corners.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Clerical Dining Hall
node.description: Long tables with benches pulled up to the sides range the length of this narrow room. At the far end, a massive sideboard is burdened with a dizzying array of food and drinks to rejuvenate tired bodies.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Library
node.description: Ancient books and scrolls line the floor-to-ceiling shelves. Rolling ladders provide access to higher volumes. Deep-cushioned couches and chairs are scattered about the room, offering comfort during long hours spent studying the ponderous texts. Special lamps, designed to emit the least amount of smoke into the air, are spaced around the room in elaborate silver sconces.

node.name: Temple of Kertigen, Clerical Dormitory
node.description: Rows of Dwarf-sized cots run down both sides of the low-ceilinged room, each separated by a moveable screen and with a carved wooden chest at its foot. Although the accommodations are not elaborate, the mattresses are thick and comfortable-looking, and the blankets warm and fluffy.

node.name: Dwarven Stomp Studio
node.description: This large rectangular chamber is bare of furniture. Several rows are marked off by chalked lines drawn along the floor. Carefully arranged against one wall are dozens of pairs of steel-toed boots from which a few people are making their selections. Above the boots is a carefully lettered sign.

node.name: Academy of Grunting
node.description: This cavern is very deep, and the slightest sound sets off an impressive series of echoes. A cart to one side holds a tray of cheeses along with large pitchers of milk and ale. In front of the food and drink are a stern-faced Dwarf and a hulking Gor'Tog who shoo away anyone trying to grab freebies.

node.name: MAMAS Hibarnhvidar, Main Office
node.description: Several small work stations ring the large cavern of the Merchant Adventurers' Mapping, Assay, and Survey Company's primary office in Forfedhdar. Tools and survey instruments lie stacked at the various stations, soon to be available for purchase by adventurers needing the latest in mining equipment. At the end of the cavern, a lone clerk stands by a counter with a set of small scales used to weigh individual items and stones of valuable minerals.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Ladar's Shop
node.description: The sounds of industry are mysteriously quiet in this small alcove of the mountain. Since many of his potential customers can perform their own repairs, the proprietor of this small shop, Ladar, has much of his time to himself. He sits on a stool at the side of the room, moving only to take care of the rare customer who wanders in.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Entry Hall
node.description: Numerous landscape paintings cover the walls of this short hallway, giving the room an illusion of windows that open on widely varying vistas. The faint noise of a commotion can be heard, seeming to emanate from a pair of gilt doors opposite the arch to the cavern.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Meeting Hall
node.description: The expansive room resembles a boisterous tavern more than it does a guildhall. Tankards and glasses on the room's four tables indicate that the revelry has been going on for quite some time, and shows no sign of slowing down. Weapon and armor racks standing near training dummies against the walls, however, hint at a time when the mood was far less celebratory. An entryway to the south seems a bit quieter.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Guildleader's Office
node.description: Although small, this office feels larger due to what appear to be windows. A second glance, however, reveals that they are actually landscapes, similar to those in the entry hall of the guild. A worktable holds some scrolls, but any guild records seem almost to be an afterthought, as the majority of the surface is covered in various containers of paintbrushes and paints. An easel in the corner displays another picture, of which the artist is either proud, or lacks wall space for display.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Doorway
node.description: This short corridor leads to an ironwood door covered with an iron grating. On both sides of the door are bronze sconces set with wide, flickering candles. Occasionally small spiders skitter across the ground towards their silken homes.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Gathering Hall
node.description: Large obsidian braziers light up granite walls inside this hexagonal hall. Although the air is slightly musty, there is no dust to be seen. Two sets of plate armor stands flank the ironwood door as if standing guard. Padded benches and chairs are scattered around the hall but do not hinder entry to other areas of the guildhall. A stairwell chiseled from the natural stone leads up to a landing.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Assembly Chamber
node.description: Primitive paintings of battles form a decorative band around the ceiling while an artistic mosaic of the Paladin Guild's crest is inlaid in the floor. Granite chairs, covered with various furs, are arranged in a semi-circle around a raised podium. A suit of darkened plate armor is displayed on a glass stand behind the podium. In the far back of the room are some deeply carved steps that lead down into darkness.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Hallway
node.description: Along one wall is a picture drawn from charcoal and chalk. While much of it is smudged, a crowd of Dwarven warriors fighting off a raging dragon can still be seen. At the far end are some massive iron doors.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Dining Hall
node.description: This circular hall is a tribute to the skilled design of the guild's architect. An expansive painted ceiling depicts a male Dwarf holding his arms out, each exaggerated arm extending down two walls. Wax candles glitter from a ruby and crystal chandelier and the wall sconces, creating light and shadows across the painted Dwarf. A long taborwood table with matching benches dominates the center of the room.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Training Room
node.description: Polished battle-axes and shields hang from reinforced wooden beams that line the stone ceiling. Large oak cabinets with bronze plaques affixed to the doors stand opposite each other against two of the walls. A Dwarven sentry stands near the doorway, eyes occasionally shifting to some squires sparring on training mats.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Pantry
node.description: The floor is made from sturdy planks of lumber combined with mortar. The whitewashed walls have pine shelves filled with food for a chef to prepare meals with. A lacquered pine countertop is available for food preparation. Two buckets filled with water are available in the corner.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Cellar
node.description: The scents of drying tobacco and herbs blend with that of aging ale and wine, creating an odd but not unpleasant odor within this large but cramped area. The walls are barely visible behind stacked barrels. The tobacco, hanging from wooden beams, scarcely allows a person space to walk without bumping against a bundle or two.

node.name: Chapel of the Last Hope, Spiritual Gardens
node.note: Chapel of the Last Hope|Spiritual Gardens
node.description: Sweet jasmine and orchids, resting in hanging brass pots, exude fragrances that fill the senses with each breath taken. A pale yellow luminescence hangs heavy in the room, providing light to the foliage living here.

node.name: Chapel of the Last Hope, Inner Sanctum
node.description: Cracked whitewashed walls add a cold but sanitary feeling. A few straw mats are piled in a corner awaiting the next pilgrim. A large gold-flecked candleholder hugs one wall while a shelf filled with white candles lines the other. Through the far archway is a small pool.

node.name: Chapel of the Last Hope, Serenity Alcove
node.description: Some hanging lanterns with luminescent globes illuminate this serene room, highlighting the various plant life springing forth from moist cracks in the walls. Thin streams of water hug the wall before settling into a small pool. The floor is lined with woven prayer mats layered with fresh gardenias.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Passageway
node.description: As if saluting any who enter from the steps, a pair of ox-tongue spears cross at the blades. The narrow passageway seems claustrophobic as smoke tendrils from torches swirl in the air. At the far end of the hall is an archway leading to an underground chamber.
The narrow passageway seems claustrophobic as smoke tendrils from torches swirl in the air. At the far end of the hall is an archway leading to an underground chamber.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Memorial of Champions
node.description: Block candles line a carpeted walkway through this enormous gallery. A myriad of canvas paintings and tapestries hang high on the stone walls. Arranged in strategic locations are carvings and wheels depicting stories through pictographs or in Haakish.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Tomb of the Fist
node.description: Thirteen wide braziers, glowing brightly, provide plenty of light in this enormous cavern. Large bearskin rugs are scattered over the stone floor. Near the center of the cavern are four stone lions standing guard around the corners of a marble dais. Looming high from the center of the dais, a granite vault dominates the space, its edges worn from age.
Thirteen wide braziers, glowing brightly, provide plenty of light in this enormous cavern. Looming high from the center of a dais, a granite vault dominates the space, its edges worn from age.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Landing
node.description: A mortar wall and steel bar railing create the bulk of this narrow walkway. Beyond the steel bar is a spectacular view of the hexagonal-shaped gathering hall in all its glory. Although there is little warmth up here, wolf pelts line the wall, and a long blue carpet leads to the guildleader's den.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Guildleader's Den
node.description: Faded tapestries depicting the thirteen Immortals are meticulously hung from the walls in this spacious office. Twin sets of plate mail, designed for the smaller races, sit on stands in two corners of the den. A carved rosewood desk and antiquated chair dominate the center of the room. Below them, an immaculate stone floor stretches from one end of the den to the other, partially covered with a plush rug in a deep burgundy thread.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Guildleader's Quarters
node.description: A large gaethzen sphere illuminates the area, lighting up the hues of dark brown and muted copper that make up the color scheme of the walls and furniture. A mid-sized canopy bed and walnut armoire fill the bulk of the room, while a glass bar and stove are tucked away in the corner.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, War Room
node.description: Books and documents line the walls on shelves with brass railings near the top. Attached to the railings are tall ladders on wheels. In the center of the room is a large, wiirwood table shaped like a nine-pointed star. Velvet cushioned chairs are placed strategically around the room while a sand table and short ironwood case sit in one corner.

node.name: Inner Hibarnhvidar, Tunnel
node.description: Solid rock walls curve gently toward each other and come together somewhere above but the peak has been lost in the shadows. Torches line the walls at regular intervals, their illumination nearly drowned out by a more intense light coming through an ogee arch. The other end of the tunnel fades into a murky darkness to the north, only visible because of the torches lining the walls.

node.name: Inner Hibarnhvidar, Tunnel
node.description: A pinprick of light to the south is the only indication that this tunnel has any end. The darkness is held at bay by a number of flickering torches bolted to the wall. Carved into the rock wall, small arrows next to the crest of the Warrior Mage guild point north.

node.name: Inner Hibarnhvidar, Tunnel
node.description: A narrow staircase plunges at a sharp, but passable, angle downward into darkness. Torches bracketed to either side illuminate both the tunnel leading southward, and the rough stone of the first few steps down.

node.name: Inner Hibarnhvidar, Narrow Stairs
node.description: A set of narrow stairs leads up at a sharp angle towards a doorway in the distance. The climb is steep in comparison to a set of broader steps which lead gently downward. The air is damp and algae has grown in the cracks between squared stone blocks which form the staircase walls.

node.name: Inner Hibarnhvidar, Narrow Stairs
node.description: A long hall separates two sets of steps, the algae-covered walls flanked by plain stone pillars. Broad stone steps gently slope upwards towards the south while to the north narrow stairs ascend steeply to an archway high above. The air is rank with a musty scent caused by stagnant puddles formed in low spots in the floor.

node.name: Inner Hibarnhvidar, Tunnel
node.description: Two large, fire-filled bronze bowls sit on either side of a small archway, working to light up the large tunnel. The flames are bright enough that they illuminate the smooth stone walls which slope upwards into a tapered point as well as a set of narrow stairs which lead down on the other side of the arch.

node.name: Inner Hibarnhvidar, Cavern Lake
node.description: Two torches are bracketed to the unnaturally smooth stone walls of an arched tunnel, dimly lighting a crag which juts out above a body of water. The feeble light does little and shadows press in oppresively as the walls fade away into oblivion, giving off a sense of vastness.

node.name: Cavern Island, Sandy Beach
node.description: A stone bridge rises out of the lake and traverses the gap between an arch in the southern wall and the shore, leading up to a gateway. Tall wicker torches line the small beach, illuminating the stone fortress' walls and giving it a menacing look. Two silver banners hang down from the crenellations and flank the gateway, each bearing the crest of the Warrior Mage Guild.

node.name: Cavern Island, Sandy Beach
node.description: Torches line the beach, flickering and sputtering in the damp cavern air and illuminating the fortress walls. The dominant sound is that of water lapping against the sandy shore, but occasionally there is the drip of falling water elsewhere in the cavern.

node.name: Cavern Island, Sandy Beach
node.description: Torches line the beach, flickering and sputtering in the damp cavern air and illuminating the fortress walls. The dominant sound is that of water lapping against the sandy shore, but occasionally there is the drip of falling water elsewhere in the cavern.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Courtyard
node.description: Large stone blocks stack atop one another to create a dull grey wall that surrounds the courtyard. A steel portcullis is raised, allowing access to and from the courtyard through an arched gateway. Large slabs of green slate pave the ground, covering nearly every square inch. Care has been put into maintaining the area as none of the slabs contain cracks or even pitting.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Courtyard
node.description: A catapult sits broken in this corner of the courtyard. The wood shows signs of rot and the throwing arm is completely smashed beyond any repair. A ladder has been set up next to the catapult, leading up the south wall.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Courtyard
node.description: A variety of mushrooms, ranging in size from pebbles to large Gnomes, fill this section of the courtyard. A drainage ditch reveals a thick layer of soft loamy soil that spreads across the stone plateau, giving the mushrooms ample fertilizer. Tightly fitted stones form what looks to be a low wall, ending almost a foot above the courtyard floor. A sign is placed at the edge of the garden bearing large, white letters.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Courtyard
node.description: A flight of white marble steps leads from the courtyard to a limestone hall. Two large brass braziers sit outside the door of the hall, casting off light and a generous amount of smoke. The limestone walls are highly polished, gleaming even in the light cast off by the braziers.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Courtyard
