node.description: A covered stone well sits next to a tall wall, which surrounds the courtyard. The well looks to be no longer in use as a large board covers up the mouth and the bucket is missing. A sign bearing large, white letters sits next to the well.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Hall
node.description: A smoky smell from years of burning torches mingles with the smell of roasted food coming from the direction of a long table. The polished oak table spans the hall, sitting directly below the peak of the thatched roof. Flanking the table on either side is a row of thick stone columns that support wooden crossbeams. A large bronze-banded oak door leads out to a courtyard paved with green slate.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Hall
node.description: A long, polished oak table sits in the center of the hall. On either side of the table are benches where a few weary looking warriors sit, eating food slowly from plates set before them. Columns artificially partition the area into three segments, creating a wide walkway on either side of a long table that makes it easier to traverse the hall without bothering feasting warriors.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Hall
node.description: A large space has been cleared at this end of the hall where a tall throne sits. The gilded chair bears the Warrior Mage Guild crest on the back. Behind the throne, two elaborate tapestries flank a small door that seems plain in comparison. A polished oak table spans the length of the hall.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Battlement
node.description: Iron sconces, bracketed to the walls outside the fortress just below crenellations in its fortifications, dimly illuminate the battlement and the lake below. Small pinpricks of light illuminate a bridge that leads to an arching entrance in a rock wall across the water from the keep. The top of a ladder can be seen peeking above the inside of the wall, leading down to the green slate floor of the courtyard.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Battlement
node.description: Iron sconces have been bracketed to the walls on the outside of the keep and provide a dim illumination. The battlements stretch from east to west, overlooking a stone bridge that leads to the southern wall of the cavern. The entrance of the Warrior Mage Guild is visible here, the crenellations angled so that a casual glance down would allow one to see anyone entering or leaving the guild. Two silver banners are visible through the crenellations, each bearing the crest of the Warrior Mage Guild.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Battlement
node.description: Iron sconces, bracketed to the walls outside the fortress just below crenellations in its fortifications, dimly illuminate the battlement and the lake below. Water from the lake laps up against a sandy shore near the base of the fortifications while a large rock wall rises up to the south. Occasionally, a loud dripping echoes from elsewhere in the cavern, disturbing the soothing sounds made by waves upon the sand.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild Forge, Supplies
node.description: Smooth stone walls have been polished to a glassy sheen. The smell of smoke is heavy in the air and comes mostly from the direction of a leather flap in the northern wall. A Dwarven attendant mutters to himself as he goes about his business of arranging and re-arranging the same items for no apparent reason.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild Forge, Hall
node.description: An intersection is formed of two hallways, one running north and south and the other east and west. In any direction the smell of smoke is thick, but breathable, made possible by the curved slope of the domed roof which leads the smoke to a large chimney directly above.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild Forge, Honing Room
node.description: An occasional shriek of metal being pressed against a grindstone echoes throughout the corridor like a victim being tortured. A light smoky scent fills the air, filtering in from elsewhere in the forge. A casual glance upwards reveals most of the smoke being directed through a chimney in the center of the ceiling. Every so often someone wanders by, carrying an assortment of weapons and looking extremely pleased.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild Forge, Honing Room
node.description: An occasional shriek of metal being pressed against a grindstone echoes throughout the corridor like a victim being tortured. A light smoky scent fills the air, filtering in from elsewhere in the forge. A casual glance upwards reveals most of the smoke being directed through a chimney in the center of the ceiling. Every so often someone wanders by, carrying an assortment of weapons and looking extremely pleased.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild Forge, Foundry
node.description: A pile of coal sits near the southern wall, waiting to be fed to a fire in the large pit occupying the center of the room. A crucible hangs from a wooden beam between the fire and several molds to facilitate the process of creating various ingots, plates and wires. Large bellows sit next to the crucible, ready to be used to fan the flames when necessary.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild Forge, Foundry
node.description: A pile of coal sits near the southern wall, waiting to be fed to a fire in the large pit occupying the center of the room. A crucible hangs from a wooden beam between the fire and several molds to facilitate the process of creating various ingots, plates and wires. Large bellows sit next to the crucible, ready to be used to fan the flames when necessary.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild Forge, Hall
node.description: A bench gently curves along with the northern wall, serving as a resting place for those waiting to use various parts of the forge. Every so often someone wanders in and out of the different arches, most likely impatient smiths waiting for their turn.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild Forge, Smithy
node.description: The room is filled with a reddish glow cast by the forge taking up most of the room. The sounds of hammer against anvil and metal grinding against stone fills the air, along with the occasional hiss of hot metal meeting water. A smoky scent fills the air every so often for a brief moment, only to be carried up the chimney in the forge's dome or one of the smaller ventilation shafts.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild Forge, Smithy
node.description: The room is filled with a reddish glow cast by the forge taking up most of the room. The sounds of hammer against anvil and metal grinding against stone fills the air, along with the occasional hiss of hot metal meeting water. A smoky scent fills the air every so often for a brief moment, only to be carried up the chimney in the forge's dome or one of the smaller ventilation shafts.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Office
node.description: A high-backed wooden chair, bearing a large pair of antlers, sits behind a cluttered desk so that it faces a small door. A large gilded bookcase sits squarely against the northern wall and has been stuffed near to bursting with various books, tomes and scrolls.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Entry
node.description: Golden-hued marble flooring flows to grey granite walls that vault high. Thick oak beams crisscross overhead, with a copper lantern suspended from each cross section, to keep the shadows at bay. Facing the arch to the cavern, an enormous tapestry composed of two horizontal panels drapes from ceiling to floor, its presence diminishing the echoes caused by the marble floor.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, East Hall
node.description: Small niches pepper the main wall, each fitted with a faceted crystal lens encircled by an iron frame. Tiny iron hinges to the left of each lens indicate a method of access to the candles that nestle in the niches. When lit, the glowing image of a riolur leaf casts a sprinkling of rainbows across the floor.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, East Hall
node.description: Large iron lanterns depend from the ceiling and host a multitude of candles that brighten the hall to a near daylight glow. The majority of the light focuses on a mural that dominates the southern wall, stretching from floor to ceiling. Due to the earthy tones and raised sections on the mural, the light casts shadows that seem to shift and move along the wall at different points.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, East Gallery
node.description: Down the center of the floor, a blue rug edged with black cord lines up evenly with the walls on each side. The hall, and the rug, ends at a pair of ornate glass doors mounted with silver-finished handles. The doors curve at the top, flaring slightly where they meet the hinges on either side.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, North Hall
node.description: Uncluttered by artifacts, the marble floor stretches across a broad, open area. Against the south wall, a golden velvet curtain tied back with a matching cord partially shrouds a staircase that spirals downward. A large break in the wall opposite the stair accesses a passage leading north.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, West Hall
node.description: Tucked into the wall, a shallow alcove houses a bubbling fountain. Fresh orange blossoms float in the glass basin of the fountain, illuminated from beneath by a carefully positioned candle. Copper-colored curtains, tied back with black silk cord, frame the space. A small mirror is mounted at the curve of the hallway leading westward to prevent collisions with those needing to turn the corner in a hurry.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, West Hall
node.description: A simple oak bench sits against the wall, padded with a smooth leather cover. Across the hall, marble columns support a latticed arch. Woven through the lattice, silk jadice flowers coil and twine around a glass representation of the Empath Guild crest. A small sign, mounted on the left column, bids welcome in many languages.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, West Hall
node.description: Down the center of the floor, a tan rug edged with gold cord lines up evenly with the walls on each side. The hall and the rug end at a large oak door that is partially ajar. Brass sconces flank the door, the candles inside flickering and leaving a thin layer of dark soot on the granite.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, North Hall
node.description: The hall narrows, decorated with clusters of portraits and paintings on the western wall. The eastern wall is blank but for a single painting surrounded by a gilded frame. To the right of the frame, a small brass plaque embedded in the granite identifies the picture.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, North Gallery
node.description: Here the passage widens again, giving way to a large arch that marks the transition into a broad room beyond. The lighting is subtle, as if to soothe and hush the regular bustle of the guildhall. An elaborately arranged stone jadice flower tiles the floor below the arch.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Library
node.description: Spacious and well lit, the library has plenty of seating covered in lush wine-colored fabric. Desks and bookcases in warm wood tones complement the fabric, giving the room a serene, comforting glow. A bespectacled young man sits at an information desk, quietly scribing on parchment as his finger taps absently against an open book. Behind him, a large case holds the most frequently requested tomes.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Guildleader's Office
node.description: A large fireplace, carved deeply into the granite wall, dominates the space. The logs inside glow red, as if the fire inside had just died down. To the right of the fireplace sit a plain desk and chair, stained in a dark finish. Muted green glass lanterns hang at various points in the room, the largest centered over the desk. Matching bookcases stand against the wall, their contents piled up and overflowing in stacks on the floor nearby.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Social Lounge
node.description: Plush rugs in shades of blue and purple carpet the ground, quieting passing footsteps. Large leather sofas and chairs cluster in small groups, occasionally decorated with throw pillows designed to coordinate with the rugs. In the far corner, a small grated fireplace set into the wall lends warmth to a room surrounded by cool granite. A stone staircase nestles against the eastern wall.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Hospital, Shalvard's Room
node.description: This small alcove off the main room is the work area of the resident healer of Hibarnhvidar. Although many adventurers utilize the services of the primary Empaths' guild, Shalvard set up this small hospital to service those who do not desire to seek help from the guild.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Hospital, Charnal Pit
node.description: Each breath forms a frosty cloud in the cold air of the room. With no windows, it is impossible to tell where you are, but the faint click of footsteps outside the door is amplified as it echoes against the stone walls. Bodies lie on tables, covered by stained sheets -- mute victims of the harshness of mountain life, and the difficulty of burial in the winter.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Sarv Stof
node.description: Whorls of copper, malachite, and azurite run from the black granite arch in the northwest corner to the open stone doors in the east wall. Large racks line the south and west walls.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Kvafelar Stof
node.description: An occasional cry of pain can be heard through the loud laughter echoing around the circular bar that dominates this room. Stone stools of varying heights surround the bar, and tankards of numerous sizes clutter it. Midway between matching sets of stone doors to the west and northeast, a set of steps climbs the wall to a raised balcony.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Ram Viikalar
node.description: Stone steps climb the wall from the drinking hall below to this wooden balcony. Large squared mikkhalbamar timbers are cantilevered from square holes in the stone wall, and thick red oak planks are laid across them. Simple stools line the stone wall, and two low oak chairs in the center of the balcony face each other across a table set with blocks and handles.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Eldar Stof
node.description: Eleven statues of barbarians line the walls, each on one knee and facing the flaming brazier in the center of the chamber. Triangular stones inlaid in the floor point from the edge of the brazier to the statues honoring it.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Tunal
node.description: Dozens of alcoves in this broad corridor keep an arsenal of weapons and armor at the ready. Torches are set into the wall between each pair of alcoves. Guild guards keep watch over the alcoves.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Viikalar Stof
node.description: Bright silver strata flow through the granite blocks, catching the torchlight to illuminate even the far corners. Training dummies are scattered about, obviously rended and repaired many times, and makeshift weapon racks stand along the north wall. Stones of various sizes protrude from the floor at different heights, no doubt meant to keep warriors mindful of their footwork.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Turn Stedh
node.description: Polished granite walls surround a massive iron chain that is sunk into the inlaid marble floor and climbs into the darkness above. Stairs lead up the north wall around the chain and into the Guildhall's famous tower, and a brushed bronze door is centered on the east wall.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Shal Turn
node.description: Silver runs in veins throughout the walls. Intricate patterns guide the eye to stairs that continue upward around the walls from the steps below. Torches are pushed through the large links of an iron chain that hangs through the center of the chamber from high above.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Shal Turn
node.description: Streaks of gold glitter in the blocks of stone carefully fit together to form the six walls that the stairs continue to spiral around. The walls smoothly transition from the four walls below into what appears to be eight above. The massive iron chain, laden with torches, continues above and below.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Shal Turn
node.description: Eight granite walls are covered with a web of platinum threads inset into the stone. Stairs, due to their lack of platinum embellishment, can be clearly seen to continue up and around the eight walls. The platinum glitters in the light from the torches jammed into the iron chain hanging through the center of the chamber. The torches barely light the steps leading down the tower.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Shal Turn
node.description: The platinum spiderweb below gives way to a lace of silver and grey animite that covers every block of this chamber's twelve walls. The heavy lace embedded in each step and makes the stairs hard to discern from the walls. A massive iron chain is set into the granite ceiling and torches have been shoved into its links. The stairs continue around the walls and upward from the steps below.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, Shal Hrot
node.description: A yard-tall rampart, punctuated with large stone slabs, surrounds two-thirds of the circular area carved from the mountainside. The jet-black granite of the floor and rampart sets off the smooth grey of the stone slabs. The architecture amplifies every footstep into an echoing clatter. Two spears stabbed into the granite mark the sides of an opening to stairs leading down.

node.name: Elding Gwilt, An Iron Chain
node.description: A wider gap between torches offers a relatively safe respite from your climb.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Lower Floor
node.description: A spiraling staircase coils against the wall flanked by iron banisters embedded in the granite for additional safety. Tucked into the curve of the staircase sits a large settee covered in a burnished gold fabric. A woven grass mat spans the oddly shaped floor, fitted carefully around the curves of the walls and staircase and halting a few inches short of a blue-tiled arch.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Antechamber
node.description: Cool blue and green tiles fan out from the arch to sprinkle the floors and walls of this small dressing room which smells slightly of damp. Warm air gusts through a doorway to the north, bringing with it the sounds of trickling water. Near the doorway, hooks line the wall, some holding assorted colored towels. A smooth wooden bench provides seating for those who wish to change.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Warm Springs
node.description: A large cavern filled with gently bubbling water spans the space, with only a small ledge running around the rim. Granite below the water near the ledges allows for easy footing when entering or exiting the pool before it descends into darkness at the midpoint. A discarded red towel lies forgotten near the doorway to the dressing room.

node.name: Warm Springs, Shallow End
node.description: Sloping from the outer ledge to a level just at a Human male's knee, the pool deepens gradually, allowing guests to relax at their own comfort. Soothing waters lightly scented with something similar to eucalyptus bubble lightly, frothing slightly from the agitation. At the center of this section, a flattened stone protrudes from the water, the surface darkened in patches from the damp.

node.name: Warm Springs, Deep End
node.description: The granite slope ends suddenly, giving way to a deep pool of water that not even a Gor'Tog can stand in. At the back of the pool, a large stack of chiseled stone slabs rises high, with runnels extending beneath an overhang and out of sight to funnel water out of the spring. At the top of the pile, one slab extends out over the center of the pool.

node.name: Trabe Plateau, Yurt
node.description: Thick furs line the walls and almost the entire floor, filling the interior with a heavy musk. A wide circular hole sits in the roof above an inert fire pit, letting in light and allowing for a glimpse up into the sky.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, Bookstore
node.description: A glaes arch divides the public forge from the main cavern. Owned by Juln, a master smith of Hibarnhvidar, the area resounds with the dull roar of the furnaces, the screech of metal against grindstones and the hiss of hot metal being quenched beyond the hatch in the south wall. At the entry, tables and counters groan beneath the weight of books for both casual and master smiths.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, Inner Corridor
node.description: Granite walls and arches support and decorate this hallowed hall of metalworking. The crackle of fire from the forges and smithies and the sharp hiss of grinding metal echo around the area in a symphony for the senses. A small hatch lined with soot leads back towards the main cavern and storeroom, and racks containing tools for sale line the walls. The other tunnels lead to destinations most suited to a smith.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, Foundry
node.description: The forging area feels warmer than most places in Hibarnhvidar due to a large fire kept constantly burning in the basement of the forge. Heat from the blaze below bleeds up into a smaller standby fire in the room, enabling a well-trained smith to work with even the most difficult of metals. A small pile of fuel sits by, waiting to be added to the fire.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, Foundry
node.description: A vent high in the ceiling helps to alleviate some of the heat circulating in this room. A hearth has been set up against one wall, its fire fed from the blazes below, allowing work to proceed at all hours of the day. A pile of fuel has been shoveled against the wall, allowing a smith to easily stoke the fire up to a raging inferno.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, Foundry
node.description: Various forging accoutrements line the walls, encircling the fire located in the center of the room. Blasts of heat from below constantly surge through the room.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, Foundry
node.description: The forge fire takes up the entire northwest wall -- the roar of the blaze drowns out all but the strongest of noises. A small access port in the center of the wall allows a smith to use the heat within for his own purposes. On the opposite side of the room a pile of fuel waits to be used.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, Tool Shop
node.description: A small alcove to one side of the room contains tables displaying tools for sale. Several vents in the ceiling gently pull warm air from the foundries nearby.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, Maker's Mark Hall
node.description: Maker's mark attendants wait in a small alcove above which hangs a variety of tools. Prestigious crafters mill about and eagerly discuss trade skills with each other. An old grindstone sits off to one side.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, Supply Depot
node.description: Fashioned similarly to the rest of the forge, this room offers additional space for the storage and sale of crafting supplies. Large wooden pallets display materials that can be ordered at any time.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, Smithy
node.description: More suited to fine detail work than mass production, this room does not contain all the amenities the larger foundries possess. However, it is much quieter, enabling smiths to concentrate on the projects at hand.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, Smithy
node.description: The fire in the small forge, primarily used to reheat weapons or to prepare smaller items, burns merrily in the south wall. A large anvil stands ready for smiths to pick up the hammer and set to work.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, Smithy
node.description: The workbench, forge and anvil take up the entire west wall of this room, though there is plenty of room to walk around. Smells of burning coal and warm metal vie for supremacy here, indicating the amount of work this room normally sees.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, Smithy
node.description: Two large counters bracket the forge and anvil located in the southeastern corner of this room. An irregular layer of soot films the walls and counters near the forge and the smell of burning flesh lingers in the room.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Hall of Healing
node.description: Shaded lanterns softly illuminate the gauzy, natural beige fabric draping the walls. A woven reed chair thickly padded and covered with a white cotton material sits against the wall beneath a blue painting. Under the chair sits a matching footstool. The arms of the chair are shaped to resemble crutches, the sides arcing inward slightly before joining and descending to the floor.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Hall of Three
node.description: Like walking into a painting, the walls of this hall are filled with color and images. Near the ceiling, shades of the sky at dawn meld into the yellowish glows of daybreak. Beneath the sky, painted scenes flow from frozen barren wasteland to the early life of spring to wheat fields in the full growth of harvest. In the center, a unicorn and a cow stand together, a foreleg of each touching the other lightly. Nearly hidden in the grasses, an adder coils tightly around the touching forelegs.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Hall of Research
node.description: Smelling slightly of crushed blocil berries, the hall features a marble-topped counter against one wall. A copper basin with a small drain is mounted on one side of the counter, while the other side features a stove and other assorted experimental tools. Above the counter, a plain wooden cabinet with clear glass doors displays shelves of mortars and jars ready for use.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Hall of Guardians
node.description: A fabricated tree extends from the wall, its created branches twisting and dipping overhead. Tiny images of woodwisps peep down through the branches. Painted on the wall, as if standing in the shadow of the tree, an alfar stands proudly, head angled to look in the distance.

node.name: Empaths' Guild, Hall of Battle
node.description: A dark red carpet covers the floor of a hallway dimly illuminated by guttering iron wall sconces. An armor stand against one wall features a chainmail armor display, with some links rusted, broken, or bloodstained. At the display's feet rest a battered shield emblazoned with the Empath Guild crest and a bundle of dried flowers tied with a sapphire-blue ribbon. Mounted on the wall, a wooden plaque featuring brass nameplates lists some of those lost in the fields.

node.name: Fang Cove, Fate's Fortune Lane
node.description: A towering marble archway opens a gap in the wall to the north and separates the ongoing construction and somewhat more refined completed structures of Fate's Fortune Lane from the crude structures and makeshift walkway along the beach. The entrance to a squat, wide bungalow sits in opposition to the arch, and the sheltering cliffs of Fang's Peak rise up from behind it. To either side of the arch, cobblestones of different shapes and sizes have been laid out to form the wide Fate's Fortune Lane.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, A Concealed Booth
node.description: In this secluded corner, a stone bench encircles a sturdy table. A recess in the wall holds a small lamp before a plate of polished silver causing light to pour into the booth.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, A Booth Behind The Screen
node.description: Several small brackets above the seats hold lamps which illuminate the area. A squat table sits in the center of the booth, hidden from view by the privacy screen.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, A Secluded Booth
node.description: An iron frame suspended from the wall supports a row of cushions lining the edge of this corner booth. A stone column in the middle has been fitted with a sheet of hammered copper, serving as a tabletop.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, Thieves' Den
node.description: A haze of smoke spitting from fatty tapers and streaming from ember-tipped cigars blankets the ceiling. The walls of the room are not without windows however, shutter, curtain and pitch effectively block out even the faintest slivers of light from the tunnels beyond. Several people can usually be found gathered around a scarred end-table, gambling on a game of dice or cards, either of which is usually accompanied by the retelling of close calls and daring escapes.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, Chamber
node.description: The chamber atop the steps is on level ground with the main barroom, though well recessed into the rock. From here the clinking of coins and tumbling of dice is audible across the stone floor downstairs. A single dim lamp casts barely enough light to make out the deadbolt lock on a solid steel door.

node.name: The Thirteenth Passage, Meeting Hall
node.description: A few lamps in wall brackets cast a faint glow across the long hall. The remaining light filters in through bottles of assorted liquor on shelves that immediately open into the back of the barroom. The center of the room is occupied by a long table. Heavy rugs covering every inch of the floor muffle footsteps, while an incredibly thick tapestry covers the back wall, making any noise sound hollow and empty.

node.name: Paasvadh Forest, Clearing
node.description: The wide clearing has random patches of lush grass intermingled with large bare spots. Workers rush to and fro, deftly cutting festival goers from the sticky bonds that confine them to the treetops enclosing the area. Children and adults alike are abuzz with excited chatter as they cross the brightly festooned bridge into the festival grounds.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Siryn's Study
node.description: Mahogany panels cover the walls of this room, warmly reflecting the light from the suspended gaethzen orbs. Several chairs around the room invite guests to sit in comfort as they discuss topics of interest. A desk sits in front of a bookcase, which is filled with tomes and scrolls on music, magic, and other subjects. A quill rests across the desk, as if only recently laid down, next to a full glass of wine.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Conference Room
node.description: A large oak table surrounded by a number of stools dominates the room. Maps cover the walls, displaying four of the provinces. On the table lies the map of Zoluren, arrows marked in red across the parchment.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Enchanting Society, Entry
node.description: Gleaming like a bright star in a night sky, an uthamar arch separates the Enchanting Society from the main cavern. Small gaethzen tetrahedrons are strategically placed to provide just enough light to see by, but not so much as to inhibit the dim, soothing ambience of the room.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Enchanting Society, Hall
node.description: Embedded within the stone walls, bits and pieces of mica sparkle underneath the gaethzen string lights that are strung across the cavern's high ceiling. Four arches of orichalcum, loimic, mistglass, and animite are positioned at each corner of the square hall and placed equidistant to each other.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Enchanting Society, Bookstore
node.description: The cavern narrows into a long, skinny chamber where one side is completely covered in bookshelves formed of marble slabs. Dwarven attendants dressed in sturdy canvas coveralls stand ready to take book orders.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Enchanting Society, Tool Store
node.description: The cavern expands outwards into a shape similar to that of a trapezoid. Carved into the back wall, open shelves are neatly stacked with various tools of the trade. Dwarven attendants dressed in sturdy canvas coveralls stand ready to take tool orders.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Enchanting Society, Supply Store
node.description: The cavern opens up into a large rhombus-shaped room with squat metal cabinets lined up against the walls. Dwarven attendants dressed in sturdy canvas coveralls stand ready to take supply orders.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Enchanting Society, Society Master's Office
node.description: The cavern terminates into a large round chamber that is softly lit with gaethzen stars. Ranging from simple to complex, sigils of all sorts are carved into the curved stone walls. A wide uthamar desk and matching chair are set at the center of the room.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Enchanting Society, Orichalcum Workroom
node.description: Deeply recessed from the hallway, the small cavern's dense stone walls protect the workroom's inhabitants from being unduly disturbed by outside noise. A sturdy granite table placed to the side of the room provides ample working space.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Enchanting Society, Loimic Workroom
node.description: Deeply recessed from the hallway, the small cavern's dense stone walls protect the workroom's inhabitants from being unduly disturbed by outside noise. A sturdy granite table placed to the side of the room provides ample working space.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Enchanting Society, Mistglass Workroom
node.description: Deeply recessed from the hallway, the small cavern's dense stone walls protect the workroom's inhabitants from being unduly disturbed by outside noise. A sturdy granite table placed to the side of the room provides ample working space.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Enchanting Society, Animite Workroom
node.description: Deeply recessed from the hallway, the small cavern's dense stone walls protect the workroom's inhabitants from being unduly disturbed by outside noise. A sturdy granite table placed to the side of the room provides ample working space.

node.name: Traveler's Shrine, Vestibule
node.description: Ranging through all the fiery shades of yellow, orange and red, the natural variance in color of the stone walls resembles dancing flames. An unusual piping song whispers through the area, occasionally falling quiet at irregular intervals. The source of the haunting music is a series of hollowed sticks fashioned into flutes and cleverly secured by the arched entry to catch any gusts of air.
Ranging through fiery shades of orange and red, the variance in color of the stone walls resembles dancing flames. A piping song whispers through the area, falling quiet at irregular intervals.

node.name: Traveler's Shrine, Refectory
node.description: Sturdy trestle tables and low stone benches offer a place to eat, drink and rest. Brass lanterns hang from the walls between pine shelves, filling the windowless room with a soft glow and the scent of lamp oil mingled with fresh baked bread and coffee. Braided rag rugs cover the stone floor between the tables and the kitchen area, where a large iron stove and a battered pine sideboard offer a variety of foods.

Sturdy tables and benches offer a place to eat. Brass lanterns hang from the walls filling the windowless room with a soft glow. Braided rag rugs cover the floor between a large iron stove and a battered pine sideboard.

node.name: Traveler's Shrine, Altar Alcove
node.description: Soaring upwards to form a dome overhead, the white walls are decorated predominantly with paint and stone mosaics that will not interfere with the exemplary acoustics of the chapel. Phoenixes shimmering with traces of copper gilt are depicted emerging from gold-streaked crimson marble flames. Each bird's attention is focused upon a portrait of a slender Elven woman with red hair.

The chapel is decorated with paint and stone that will not interfere with the exemplary acoustics. Emerging from a mosaic of flames, phoenixes direct their attention to a portrait of a slender Elven woman with red hair.

node.name: Traveler's Shrine, Dormitory
node.description: Amber-shaded lamps illuminate the area with warm light. Spartanly furnished, the dormitory is lined with iron cots piled with wool blankets and stone bins to keep clutter to a minimum. Thick curtains divide the room into smaller areas, to give some modicum of privacy as well as to keep out chilling drafts.
Amber-shaded lamps illuminate the area. Spartanly furnished, the dormitory is lined with iron cots and stone bins. Thick curtains divide the room into smaller areas.

Spartanly furnished, the dormitory is lined with iron cots piled with wool blankets and stone bins to keep clutter to a minimum. Thick curtains divide the room into smaller areas, to give some modicum of privacy as well as to keep out chilling drafts. The soft glow of amber-shaded lamps light the room enough so late arrivals do not stumble in the dark, but not brightly enough to disturb sleepers.

Spartanly furnished, the dormitory is lined with iron cots and stone bins. Thick curtains divide the room into smaller areas. The lamps light the room enough so late arrivals do not stumble in the dark, but not brightly enough to disturb sleepers.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Dark Passageway
node.description: The ceiling and floor are made of smooth marble. A chill in the air makes the silence nearly tangible and thickly oppressive, capable of driving even the most level-headed Dwarf completely mad. In the middle of the floor is a small image.
The ceiling and floor are made of smooth marble. In the middle of the floor is a small image.

The ceiling and floor are made of smooth marble. In the middle of the floor is a small image.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Dark Passageway
node.description: A single torch lights up the small tunnel and an archway on the western end. Two stone lions, intricately carved directly from the wall, flank the archway. Soulstone eyes appear to blink in the flickering torchlight.
A single torch lights up the small tunnel and an archway on the western end. Two stone lions, intricately carved directly from the wall, flank the archway.

node.name: Excavated Site, Burial Chamber
node.description: Although well-kept, this chamber appears to have been hollowed out with little thought for aesthetics. Lining the back wall are animite chests with thick locks. Sitting on top of each chest are various sets of armor worn by time. Near the center of the room is a half-rotten wooden coffin, barely preserved but for a large glass box sealed over it. Displayed on top of the box is a set of old mail armor with butted links.
Lining the back wall are animite chests with thick locks. Near the center of the room is a half-rotten wooden coffin, barely preserved but for a large glass box sealed over it.

node.name: Excavation Site, Antechamber
node.description: Like the burial chamber, this room has been hastily dug out. It appears that the builder put more thought into what items would be in here than ensuring safety when traversing the jaggedly cut walls and uneven floor. Hanging from a hook is a metal mobile with hammered discs dangling from it.
Like the burial chamber, this room has been hastily dug out. Hanging from a hook is a metal mobile with hammered discs dangling from it.

node.name: Skin Deep
node.description: Distressed bricks line the walls of this small room, their muted red hue complementing the dark russet tones of the black locust wood floor. A trio of lanterns hung from the center of the ceiling illuminates the room and casts a soft light over the space. In the corner rests a small desk strewn with tiny doodles captured on scraps of paper.

node.name: Many Sign of Many Savage, Open Chamber
node.note: Many Sign of Many Savage|Signs|Markers|Area Markers
node.description: Holes in the chamber's roughly hewn walls allow air to circulate in and out from other nearby facilities. Tapestries and maps depicting far off places are prominently displayed, and the shop's owner frequently pauses before one or another to stare wistfully. As patrons come and go, he seems particularly excited by non-Dwarven visitors and does his best to speak to them in very broken common.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Alchemy Society, Entrance
node.description: Polished stone walls gleam in the diffused light cast by bronze lamps overhead. A pair of frosted glass doors leads back out into the bustling caverns of Hibarnhvidar. A long carpet runner, decorated with alchemical herbs and tools, runs from the doors deeper into the society.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Alchemy Society, Lobby
node.description: Cozy groupings of chairs and sofas provide a spot to socialize and network for those society members taking a break from alchemical processes. Wall sconces provide subdued lighting that helps relieve eyestrain from staring at too many retorts or stoves. The quiet murmur of conversations fills the background as members relax and unwind.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Alchemy Society, Books
node.description: Shelves display books available for purchase while a chart shows techniques. A clerk notes work order completions on a board.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Alchemy Society, Supplies
node.description: Shelves of spices, herbs, and other ingredients line the walls while clerks dart to and fro filling orders for customers. A long counter allows for the inspection of the various supplies before final purchase.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Alchemy Society, Workroom
node.description: A set of alchemical equipment is centered in this laboratory carved out of living rock. Pipes along the ceiling are covered with holes that provide a way for any deadly gasses released to eventually be piped to the surface.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Alchemy Society, Workspace
node.description: A set of alchemical equipment is centered in this laboratory carved out of living rock. Pipes along the ceiling are covered with holes that provide a way for any deadly gasses released to eventually be piped to the surface.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Alchemy Society, Workshop
node.description: A set of alchemical equipment is centered in this laboratory carved out of living rock. Pipes along the ceiling are covered with holes that provide a way for any deadly gasses released to eventually be piped to the surface.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Alchemy Society, Tools
node.description: Stacks of supply crates line the walls while the counter displays various alchemical tools for sale. Frazzled-looking clerks help customers with their purchases.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Alchemy Society, Office
node.description: Except for a desk, there is little to mark out this area as belonging to the Society Master. The heaps of papers on the desk vie with bits of dried plants and various other ingredients, all of them fighting a losing battle to not slide off the messy desk onto the floor.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Outfitting Society, Reception
node.description: Carved into the living stone, the large circular room has eight equally spaced exits. A desk stands near the wall, situated to keep an eye on all the traffic moving through the outfitting society. The mirror smooth walls are hung with bright tapestries that display the talents of the members of the society.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Outfitting Society, Spinning Hall
node.description: Large wicker baskets stand near the spinning wheel in the center of the room, ready for holding supplies for artisans working on new projects. While one stool is placed at the wheel, a few others of varied heights line the walls, allowing spinners of any height to sit comfortably at the wheel and work.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Outfitting Society, Spinning Room
node.description: Large wicker baskets stand near the spinning wheel in the center of the room, ready for holding supplies for artisans working on new projects. While one stool is placed at the wheel, a few others of varied heights line the walls, allowing spinners of any height to sit comfortably at the wheel and work.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Outfitting Society, Weaving Hall
node.description: A few sturdy shelves rest against the stone walls of the chamber, providing space for supplies to be stored. In the center of the room, a wooden loom stands under a series of hanging lanterns which bathe the room in brilliant light. A bench stands in front of the loom, ready for someone to sit and weave.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Outfitting Society, Weaving Hall
node.description: A few sturdy shelves rest against the stone walls of the chamber, providing space for supplies to be stored. In the center of the room, a large loom stands under a series of hanging lanterns which bathe the room in brilliant light. A bench stands in front of the loom, ready for someone to sit and weave.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Outfitting Society, Supply Emporium
node.description: Cubbyholes chiseled from the rock walls display the vast array of fabrics, leathers and other supplies available to members for their projects. Swatches of some of the textiles and threads are set out on the counter for inspection before purchase.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Outfitting Society, Book Emporium
node.description: Racks hold the manuals and booklets available for purchase, allowing the patrons to peruse before taking their selections to the polished stone counter near the door. A bearded Dwarf stands ready at the counter to assist shoppers with questions or to complete purchases.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Outfitting Society, Tool Emporium
node.description: Sturdy shelves behind the long wooden counter hold a variety of tools needed by the members of the society, all neatly stored away for easy access. A burly looking Dwarf stands behind the counter, his beady eyes missing nothing that happens in the chamber.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Outfitting Society, Office
node.description: Thick tapestries cover the walls, obscuring the stone the chamber was carved from. Papers are piled on the desk in haphazard stacks, threatening to spill over the floor at any moment. Swatches of cloth and design sketches fill a small rolling cart next to the desk, ready for the next project.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Engineering Society, Entry
node.description: Scents of oils, ash, and other unidentifiable odors waft through the entryway, drifting from deeper within the Society. A passageway to the east leads to the master's office, while a wider tunnel in the south wall provides access to the rest of the working areas. A few chairs, battered from much use, sit on the polished stone floor.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Engineering Society, Office
node.description: Metal racks line the walls, holding a variety of bins, boxes, and baskets. Each container is labeled with a neatly-lettered tag denoting what is stored within. A wide table in the center of the room is covered with paperwork while a comfortable chair is pushed back from the surface.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Engineering Society, Depot
node.description: Standing in the center of the room is a large semi-circular counter, behind which busy clerks take and fulfill orders for the crafters. A large crate stands at one end of the counter while a sign hangs on one wall.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Engineering Society, Workspace
node.description: Roughly in the center of the room stands a work bench covered with tools. Gouges and scratches mar the thick planks of the worktable's surface. Wood shavings and stone bits dot the polished stone floor.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Engineering Society, Workshop
node.description: Roughly in the center of the room stands a work bench covered with tools. Gouges and scratches mar the thick planks of the worktable's surface. Wood shavings and stone bits dot the polished stone floor.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Engineering Society, Workroom
node.description: Roughly in the center of the room stands a work bench covered with tools. Gouges and scratches mar the thick planks of the worktable's surface. Wood shavings and stone bits dot the polished stone floor.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Engineering Society, Toolstore
node.description: Tools hang from corkboard decorating this long, rectangular room. A thick scent of oil clings to the air, and the scraping sound of stone sharpening metal drones on in the background. Some nearby salespeople wait to help customers.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Engineering Society, Bookstore
node.description: Most of the room is blocked off by a long counter behind which stand tall bookshelves in neat rows. Busy clerks move between the counter and the shelves, filling orders for the engineers. An overpowering scent of ink and leather fills the area.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Carousel Family Services
node.description: A series of guarded arches line the southern wall. The complicated framework of iron and timbers spans across the ceiling. Countless gears, pulleys and weights form the strikingly complex mechanism which drives the Carousel.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Item Registration Office
node.description: A few gaethzen spheres on the ceiling provide a dim light to the underground office. Damp walls surround the office which has a few cabinets and a low counter with a content looking Dwarven clerk behind it.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Registrar's Office
node.description: An even smaller portion of the cave is portioned off for the registrar. A single gaethzen sphere is set into a carved stone desk providing just enough light to get the necessary paperwork accomplished. A few cabinets can be made out, hiding amongst the shadowy walls.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Outfitting Society, A Private Outfitting Room
node.description: A pure-white wainscoted hall is topped by lilac-hued paisley painted walls. Occupying the back third of the room is a solid-looking loom, while a large spinning wheel sits near the entrance. Resting atop a deep purple rug is a sturdy worktable and a comfortable, wicker chair. Running parallel along opposing walls are several hooks and shelves, holding practically every conceivable tool, spool of thread, bobbin, thimble and scrap.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Forging Society, A Private Forge
node.description: Thick walls struggle to contain the blistering heat of the workshop where the fires blaze endlessly night and day. The flickering flames give a reddish glow to the racks and shelves of tools and equipment, all neatly placed and ready for use. Workers enter in their protective gear from time to time, checking the equipment and reporting back to a sentry at the entry.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Engineering Society, A Private Engineering Room
node.description: A fine layer of wood and stone shavings covers most of the well-worn granite floor. The white walls have seen better days, and black and grey scuff marks adorn much of the open space. A large workstation along one wall is unnaturally free of clutter and holds several organized tools and implements. Grunts, curses, and labored breathing from other patrons echo throughout the large workroom.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Alchemy Society, A Private Alchemy Room
node.description: A large workbench dominates one side of the room with numerous pieces of alchemical equipment scattered haphazardly upon its surface. The high, vented windows provide relief from the common, yet unpleasant, smell that permeates the room.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar Enchanting Society, A Private Enchanting Room
node.description: Pieced together by a seemingly blind worker, the walls are covered with scraps of rugs, blankets, and carpets in a kaleidoscope of colors. A burly, light pink feldspar table is stashed in a corner of the room, providing plenty of room to work.

node.name: Hibarnhvidar, Rundmolen Post Office
node.description: Tucked away in a corner of the cavern is a long stone counter set out from the wall. A colorful mural covers the wall behind the counter, depicting brawny dwarves at work at a variety of tasks. Vast, countless rows of differently sized shelves are behind the counter, and complex Dwarven mechanisms can be heard as they rearrange the package-covered storage. Clerks shuffle endlessly back and forth between the counters and shelving as they assist patrons with their packaging and mailing needs.

node.name: Dabrush Brawn, Inside
node.description: Haphazardly placed into crevices within the surrounding craggy stone walls, oil lanterns provide a steady light with no flickering. A pair of displays are placed side by side at the center of the cavern, showcasing the fine wares of the shop.
